IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TRINITY-PAWLING IS AN INDEPENDENT BOY'S COLLEGE PREPARATORY SCHOOL. THE SCHOOL IS COMMITTED TO THE EDUCATION OF ITS STUDENTS AND THEIR DEVELOPMENT AS A WHOLE. ITS GOAL IS TO PLACE EACH GRADUATE IN A COLLEGE OR UNIVERSITY THAT WILL BE APPROPRIATELY CHALLENGING AND WILL ALLOW THE OPPORTUNITY FOR ACADEMIC SUCCESS AND PERSONAL DEVELOPMENT.
IRS990.MissionDesc: TO EDUCATE AND INSTILL A VALUE SYSTEM THAT PREPARES YOUNG MEN TO BE CONTRIBUTING MEMBERS OF SOCIETY AMIDST THE CHALLENGES OF AN EVER-CHANGING WORLD.
IRS990.Desc: INSTRUCTIONAL EXPENSES ARE INCURRED TO PROVIDE STUDENTS WITH EDUCATIONAL INSTRUCTION, THE SCHOOL'S PRIMARY PURPOSE.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: AUXILIARY EXPENSES ARE FOR ROOM AND BOARD AND EXPENSES GENERATED FROM THE SALE OF TEXTBOOKS AT THE SCHOOL STORE; AND PROVIDING PHYSICAL SUPPORT AND EDUCATIONAL GUIDANCE TO STUDENTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE SCHOOL RECEIVED 51 WORKS OF ART VALUED AT $28,000 ON 11/15/11. THE PIECES ARE AN EXAMPLE OF THE WORKS OF LOCAL ARTISTS AND THE INTENT OF THE DONATION IS THAT THEY WILL MAKE EXCELLENT LEARNING TOOLS WITH THE SCHOOL'S ART PROGRAM.
SCHOLARSHIPS, FACULTY DEVELOPMENT AND SCHOOL-RELATED ACTIVITIES.

THE SCHOOL IS GENERALLY EXEMPT FROM FEDERAL INCOME TAX UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE. IT IS, HOWEVER, REQUIRED TO FILE AN INFORMATION OR TAX RETURN (FEDERAL FORM 990 AND A 990T WHEN APPROPRIATE). THE SCHOOL BELIEVES THAT THERE ARE NO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS THAT ARE MATERIAL TO THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.
LOSS ON SALE OF OTHER ASSETS REPORTED IN REVENUE ON TAX RETURN, LINE 7
LOSS ON SALE OF OTHER ASSETS REPORTED IN EXPENSES IN FINANCIAL STATEMENTS

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE D, PART V, LINE 1B, COLUMN A:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: CERTAIN RECLASSIFICATIONS WERE MADE TO THE 2015 FINANCIAL STATEMENT PRESENTATION TO CORRESPOND TO THE CURRENT YEAR'S FORMAT. ADJUSTMENT OF $6,047,498 WAS MADE TO CURRENT YEAR CONTRIBUTIONS TO REFLECT THESE CHANGES. TOTAL NET ASSETS AND CHANGE IN NET ASSETS ARE UNCHANGED DUE TO THESE RECLASSIFCATIONS.
NONDISCRIMINATORY POLICY IS DISCLOSED IN ITS ANNUAL BROCHURE, NEWSPAPER ADVERTISEMENTS AND WEBSITE.
ACCRUAL BASIS EXPENDITURES PER AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.
FINANCIAL AID IS AWARDED EACH YEAR SOLELY ON THE BASIS OF NEED, AND REQUIRES THE FAMILIES TO SUBMIT AN APPLICATION AND PARENTS FINANCIAL STATEMENT.

THE ORGANIZATION PROVIDES THE FOLLOWING FOR WILLIAM W. TAYLOR (CURRENT HEADMASTER): 1. HOUSING, TELEPHONE AND CABLE (APPROXIMATELY $21,600, $600, AND $600, RESPECTIVELY). 2. DISCRETIONARY FUND OF $8,500 (INCLUDES CLUB MEMBERSHIP OF $7,082). 3. TRAVEL FOR WIFE. 4. MAID SERVICE. THE ORGANIZATION PROVIDED THE FOLLOWING FOR ARCHIBALD A. SMITH III (FORMER HEADMASTER): 1. HOUSING, TELEPHONE AND CABLE (APPROXIMATELY $21,600, $600, AND $600, RESPECTIVELY). 2. TRAVEL FOR WIFE. 3. MAID SERVICE.

ARCHIBALD A. SMITH III RECEIVED A PAYMENT ON HIS 457(F) PLAN FOR $89,068.29 IN JANUARY 2015 WHICH WAS INCLUDED IN HIS 2015 W-2. HE ALSO BECAME ELIGIBLE ON 6/30/15 TO BEGIN DISTRIBUTIONS ON HIS PERSONAL DEFERRED CONTRIBUTIONS INTO HIS 457(B) PLAN.

AND FINANCE THE ACQUISITION, CONSTRUCTION, RENOVATION, INSTALLATION AND EQUIPPING OF (1) A NEW SYNTHETIC TURF FIELD, (2) RELOCATING AN EXISTING PARKING LOT, (3) REPLACING 12 TENNIS COURTS, FINANCING THE REPAIRING, RENOVATING, OR REPLACING OF ANY OTHER FACILITIES, PAYING OF ANY REDEMPTION PREMIUMS ASSOCIATED WITH THE 1998 AND 2002 BOND ISSUES, AND, LASTLY, PAYING ALL OF OR A PORTION OF THE COSTS OF ISSUANCE OF THE 2013 BOND.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FORM 990 WILL BE REVIEWED BY THE ORGANIZATION'S AUDIT COMMITTEE WHO WILL MAKE RECOMMENDATIONS TO THE BOARD.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: TRUSTEES, OFFICERS, ADMINISTRATORS, FACULTY AND OTHER EMPLOYEES OF THE SCHOOL ARE REQUIRED TO COMPLY WITH THE WRITTEN CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND SIGN POLICY ANNUALLY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE ANNUALLY REVIEWS THE PERFORMANCE OF TOP EXECUTIVES AS WELL AS COMPARATIVE COMPENSATION INFORMATION, AND MAKES RECOMMENDATIONS TO THE FULL BOARD OF TRUSTEES FOR APPROVAL.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST.
PENSION AND POST-RETIREMENT BENEFIT RELATED CHANGES -97,194.
OVERSIGHT, REVIEW AND SELECTION PROCESS HAS NOT CHANGED FROM PRIOR YEAR.
